name: (2E)-3-(5-bromofuran-2-yl)-1-furan-2-ylprop-2-en-1-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1178
Reason: The compound has a basic unit of furan, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The bromine atom in the target compound increases the melting point due to increased electronegativity and polarity. The 5-bromofuran-2-yl group contributes to a further increase in melting point due to increased steric hindrance and electron donating ability. The furan ring in the molecule also contributes to a slight increase in melting point due to its rigidity and hydrogen bonding capability. The overall effect of these functional groups on the melting point can be estimated to be around 80-120 degrees Celsius.
